revised_title: Evidence of a Large Extinct Monotreme: Echidna Ramsayi from Wellington Breccia Cave, New South Wales
tldr: The author examines a large extinct monotreme, Echidna Ramsayi, found in the Wellington Breccia Cave, New South Wales. The humerus of this species reveals unique characteristics that distinguish it from other monotremes and provides insight into the evolution and affinities of the mammalian class in Australasia.
